title: Stop making tank items cheaper but reducing their stats
body:
It makes it so that late game, you dont have the itemization to deal with ADCs and actually feel tanky, because every item is made for mid/early game and there are barely any late game LARGE, EXPENSIVE tank items left in the game.

ADCs and mages have items that cost 3000+ gold, tanks are lucky to spend 2800 on an item.  Its happened since the Tank rework and its gotten worse every patch.

replies.body: Tank is straight up weaker in every aspect, with less resistance in all the items, as well as for god know why buff to every adc item.
I think the only exception to this is darius, who can build full tank and still erase half your team

Forgive me if I'm wrong, but isn't offense supposed to outscale defense. I agree with you that tank items shouldn't become cheaper by losing stats, but I have some opposition to the idea of making a large and expensive late game tank item because either items like last whisper and void staff will end up making it much worse or it would become an overbearing item.

Offense does outscale defense, its just supposed to take 35+ minutes before that really starts to happen

Defense scales as Health x Armor (or MR).

Offense scales as (AD x AS) x (Crit chance + Crit damage) + Armor pen/shred/ignore


Offense will always outscale defense, it's just that it doenst feel good to be full tank late game anymore, as there are no 3000+ gold tank items that provide 3000 or more gold worth of stats.  Meanwhile AD and AP have several "large" items to make them feel powerful, Riot keeps changing tank items to be cheaper, but provide less stats
Keep in mind that [most games are over at 35 minutes](http://www.leagueofgraphs.com/de/rankings/game-durations).

There's kinda 2 problems with that though. 

For starter's Bolstering the final cost of big ticket item, will make it more difficult for tanks to build more proactively. This is less of a problem for glass cannons, because they usually only have one damage source. Tank classes on the other hand, would need to respond to the changing battle field. (Is it the ADC or APC who's fed?) 

Secondly, the Glass cannon DPS, is pretty much the only champ who's capable of dealing with the tank when final builds role out. Given that the ADC is pretty vulnerable to everyone else, They have to retain their trump card against tanks. But even if they got completely out of control. (especially in a multi ADC meta) You still have specific items to help counter them. (Randuin's, Frozen Heart, Thornmail)

Erh...

Maybe not bursting, but definitely chunking.

Maybe with a full glass cannon build, but the tank can chunk them just as effectively then.

Plus mages have cds, so any spells spent on the tank aren't hitting the backline.

{{champion:34}} , {{champion:63}} , {{champion:96}} (if a mage or otherwise), {{champion:13}} , {{champion:50}} , {{champion:4}} , {{champion:45}} , {{champion:161}} , {{champion:112}} , {{champion:101}} 

none of these mages have any problems hitting the back line and the front line at the same time

And none of those mages should be kiting a semi-competent tanks with the exception of Ryze, TF, and  maybe Veigar or Vik(both have a large part of their ability to kite tied into spells on longish cds)

If you are getting kited by Xerath or Vel then it's time to hang it up, because that is player problem, not a champion inherent issue.  Mages need peel to keep tanks off of them, and they will struggle to deal damage unless fullbuild(and even then it takes multiple rotations with down time due to cd's)

Anivia has a large area slow field, a stun, and a wall that she can use to kite.  She can kite well enough to get away but probably not enough to really want to try kiting across an entire map.

Brand has no problems kiting.  If (and he probably does) he builds a Rylai's he has no trouble and can watch the tank burn to death the whole way.

Swain is in a similar situation to Brand, he can just keep walking so long as his mana holds out.  He might not even need to use his ultimate for extended periods of time.

Viktor can definitely kite, he has a speed boost on his Q.  Hand him a Rylai's and job done.

Vel'Koz has a strong slow on his Q and a knockback/up on his E.  Combine that with no cast time on his W and he doesn't have much trouble.  Pretty strong self peel is one of Vel's strengths, along with tank shredding with his true damage.

Anivia you are right about, the rest no so much.  

Vik's speed boost is worthless compared to the mobility some tanks have, which is why I was looking more at his ult as his main, **reliable** kiting tool.

Brand has one rotation of abilities and then he gets caught, not to mention the how prevalent spell shields are, and that his stun is a slower skillshot.  No way in hell he kites a tank with any mobility or cc.

Swain can kite, once he get's Rylais, but only to a degree, and of course he usually builds tankier rather than full ap.

Vel's q is a easily dodged skill shot, as is his knockback and his true damage is flat meaning it doesn't do much to counter high health tanks unless he procs it a shit ton with his ult(which means he's rooted, catchable, and likely dead if he doesn't get the kill)

I'm sorry, but holding up immobile champs and pointing out that they do in fact have a few forms of cc, doesn't mean they automatically become some kiting gods.  

Things like Mao's huge snare, and his point and click dash, Zac's long range knockup, and Sej's dash, and multiple stuns kinda make those item dependent skill shot slows look weak and unreliable.  You may get zoned off by any one of these champs, but in doing so they present a pretty generous window to engage as all of their self peel is on cd or they lack much if any reliable self peel to begin with.

The range of Maokai and Sejuani's dashes are not so large that most of those mages don't outrange them significantly (Zac is all about that unparalleled engage range, no outranging that).  Yes, they have their ults to make sure they can get onto targets, but that is what the likes of Sej, Maokai and Zac are supposed to do: force fights to start.  If you want to keep them off your backliners then put someone in the way to eat that CC or slow them down.

Worth remembering:  you can walk faster than a Maokai ult, Sej ult only stuns you on a direct hit, and Zac's E has a one second warning to avoid.  Combine that with a popular new AP item called Banshee's Veil and you won't have trouble not getting caught (except maybe with Zac, getting over big distances is his thing).

Brand doesn't kite by throwing his entire kit at someone then walking away, he spreads out his spell usage to allow his passive to burn you as much as possible.  That whole time you are slowed by Rylai's and he can potentially stun you as well, but he probably doesn't need to.

When Vik builds his Rylai's his main kiting tool against the likes of Sej or Mao would probably be his E or W, not his ult.  The ult is good, yes, but his E has a short enough cooldown, applies the slow again after a delay for longer slowing and has no cast time so that it also works fine for this.

Swain has a slow on his Q and has a snare on his W.  He has no issues kiting without Rylai's, go ahead and walk through his bird's laser field and into the snare.

Vel's Q isn't so easily dodged when you want to walk towards Vel.  He shoots it straight at you, so you sidestep it and then he makes it split into you or makes you dodge backwards to avoid it.  It doesn't need to hit to slow you down, if it makes you walk backwards than it is doing enough.

Problem 1 is easy to solve. Tanks lack a good powerfull option for raw maxhealth, and maxhealth works vs both magic and physical damage, leaving %damage as the intendet anti tank mechanic. Something like the good old S2 warmongs, over 3k costs, a stacking mechanic that prevents it from beeing overbearing as a rushed item but therefor tons of hp and incombat(!)-regen for mid-late.
The midgame spikes of tanks mabye need some small nerfs then.

Problem 2 does not exist, tankiness is so low that prettymuch everyone but support and tank can easily take down tanks over some time(Yes, it's totally fine if killing a tank takes some solid time), If glasscannons are invloved, tanks simply get blasted prettymuch ever since S6, and that's not ok.
And the anti adc items do shit, especially since many other classes are a threat for tanks aswell, especially if grouped up. A tank should not be afraid to be the first in the fray, but right now you need either imidiate followup, which usually requires high coordination which you don't have in soloQ, or you engage and just die on the spot come to lategame.

Not only that, tanks are weaker midgame than they were before 7.9. Before, you can actually be able to tank and lock down a fed adc from 20-30 minutes. Now, when I play tank I find myself getting shredded by 2.5 item adcs at 25 minutes.

riot is nerfing tank items into the ground and compensating by giving them more obnoxious defense steroids for 'windows of power'

unfortunately this leaves bruisers in the dust

This here. I used to do a lot of bruisers. They nerfed all the closing gap items. They added tons of steroids to adcs. They added tons of pen. They added true damage to every other champ. Months ago we were all bitching that hps items were either not enough of them or that items with them did not add enough. So now they nerf hps as well. The only true tankiness anymore comes from straight up hard aoe cc. So tanks are free to build damage/hps items and not be any worse off. Bruisers are left in the dust.

I mean, look at Garen. Him and his black cleaver and the other team are losing like 50 percent of their armor and these days seems like every ad just builds flat out pen and lw if there is someone stacking armor. It makes it feel crappy to try to build any tankiness against ad's since now you don't have armor or hps, And since that garen died 2 seconds after he hit the enemy team, it feels crappy for him too.

Now in addition to having a really bad late game, and a bad midgame, you get crap early game as well. When I get tanky champ without a lot of cc on ARAM, i usually just buy lots of hps items that aren't armor also and then pick up thornmail (nerfed not long ago) and tabai (just nerfed). Better than buying the hps/armor items.

Tanks feel more frail every patch since season 5; unfortunately riot won't gut offensive champions, nor are they likely to give defensive champions anything significant. It's a major part of why there's so littler strategic diversity left in the game. 
Why get a tank when a marksmen can survive longer thanks to lifesteal? Why play a tank when fighters have significant crowd control? Why play tanks that take time to scale up, and the game is over after a couple kills? Why play tanks that never get to stay durable, because riot repeatedly buffs damage? 
Riot has and continues to stalemate the game with their biased balancing.
